frame.name: Finish_game
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Player</fen> finishes a <fen>Game</fen>, possibly with an outcome of winning or losing. A <fen>Game</fen> is an activity that is considered recreational, and is valued for associated pleasure, as well as social interaction, material reward, or status. Not all games can be won or lost. Those that are specifically competitions are defined in the inheriting frame Finish_competition. In some LUs, the <fen>Game</fen> is DNI.
<ex> <fex name="Player">John</fex> <t>won</t> <fex name="Game">the lottery</fex>! </ex> <ex> <fex name="Player">John</fex> <t>lost</t>. </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the <fen>Game</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Player</fen> that also affect their action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An action of the <fen>Player</fen> that results in the outcome of the <fen>Game</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Game</fen> takes place.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: win.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: complete a game with a favorable outcome

lexUnit.name: lose.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: complete a game with an unfavorable outcome
